definition: to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good

sentences.english: Many of the local dignitaries attended the funeral.
sentences.chinese: 许多本地的达官贵人都参加了葬礼。

sentences.english: People in the street, ask crew-cut dignitaries asked in temple.
sentences.chinese: 平头百姓求于街头，达官显贵问于庙堂。

sentences.english: Money can buy a lot of influence.
sentences.chinese: 金钱可结交许多达官贵人。

sentences.english: So far as I know, there are many VIPs who are going to attend the reception.
sentences.chinese: 就我所知有很多达官贵人将出席这个招待会。

sentences.english: Kings, chiefs and bishops have always chosen me for I am a sign of authority and wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 达官贵人老是选择我，由于我意味着权势巨子和智慧。

sentences.english: You like real people and are not dazzled by dignitaries.
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢真实不做作的老百姓，不崇拜达官贵人。

sentences.english: The barber shaved only distinguished people , and he too already looked upon the house as his own.
sentences.chinese: 剃头匠专为达官贵人修面，也认为房子非他莫属。

sentences.english: The celebrities and the persons of refined taste liked to present the inner-painted snuff bottles to officials and friends as exquisite gifts.
sentences.chinese: 名人雅士多以内画壶作为别致礼品赠送达官友人。

definition: high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
lit. peddlers and carriers/common people/lower class
family of a functionary (i.e. educated middle class in Qing times)
